main event: A series of unidentified aerial objects were reported over Oak Ridge, Tennessee, from 12 to 13 October 1950, with radar sightings and various eyewitness accounts.
interesting points: The security patrol at the Atomic Energy Commission Plant reported seeing bright lights maneuvering at altitudes between 1500 and 3000 feet., Radar targets were detected, but no objects were visually confirmed by the fighter interceptors sent to investigate., The radar showed objects in patterns not typical of known aircraft, leading to various descriptions from witnesses., Investigations concluded there were no identifiable aircraft in the vicinity at the time of the sightings., The phenomenon was suspected to be related to atmospheric conditions, causing radar malfunctions.
witness description: various observers including security patrol members and military personnel
